This horizontal positioning means may comprise a motor which propels the wheels of the front guiding means and/or of the rear guide means for the cutting area bottom CAB. A further implementation of this horizontal positioning means can be combined with the horizontal traversal bearing TB as shown in Fig. 5 and Fig. 6 and can also be integrated into the embodiment of Fig. 1 to Fig. 4.

The horizontal positioning means may comprise at least one cylinder which can move an object to the left as well as to the right, i.e. the cylinder operates in a double-acting manner. The horizontal positioning means is connected with the frame and with the cutting area bottom CAB.

In one implementation a left lateral cantilever element is mounted at the left side of the frame and a right lateral cantilever element is mounted at the right side. For shifting the cutting area bottom CAB to the left a left cylinder Cyl1 .1 or a left spring being part of the horizontal positioning means shifts the cutting area bottom CAB towards the left lateral cantilever element. The left cylinder Cyll l or spring is connected with this left lateral cantilever element. A right cylinder CyH .r or a right spring connected with the right lateral cantilever element shifts the cutting area bottom CAB towards the right lateral cantilever element. This implementation enables a stable mechanism for shifting laterally the cutting area bottom CAB. The lateral movement of the cutting area bottom CAB, however, is restricted to the range between the two lateral cantilever elements. The distance between the two horizontal cylinders Cyll l, CyH .r limits the way of the cutting area bottom CAB.

The top view of Fig. 6 shows the embodiment with the traversal bearing TB. A left horizontal cylinder Cyl1 .1 is mounted at the frame (left side of the horizontal cylinder Cyll l) and at the left side of the cutting area bottom CAB (right side of the horizontal cylinder Cyll l). A right horizontal cylinder CyH .r is mounted at the frame (right side of the horizontal cylinder CyH .r) and at the right side of the cutting area bottom CAB (left side of the horizontal cylinder CyH .r). The left cantilever element CE. I connects the left horizontal cylinder Cyll l with the frame. The right cantilever element CE.r connects the right horizontal cylinder Cyl1 .r with the frame. In Fig. 5 the horizontal cylinders Cyll l, CyH .r and the cantilever elements CE. I, CE.r are omitted for sake of clarity. The two horizontal cylinders Cyl1 .1, Cyl1 .r can shift the cutting area bottom CAB laterally to the left or to the right.
It is also possible to provide the embodiment of Fig. 1 to Fig. 4 with such a horizontal positioning means, e. g. with two vertical cylinders CyH .I, Cyllr.

In the two implementations just sketched the cutting area bottom CAB can be shifted with respect to the left and/or to the right with respect to the frame and with respect to the connecting assembly. In an alternative embodiment these implementations can be used to shift the cutting assembly KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14 laterally with respect to the cutting area bottom CAB. Before shifting the cutting assembly it is necessary to pivot the knives Kn.1 , Kn. 14 out of the longitudinal slots SI.1 , SI. 14.

In one implementation of this alternative embodiment at least one wheel, preferably two wheels W.I, W.r or two front wheels and two rear wheels, are pivotally connected with the cutting assembly. At least one guiding rail, preferably two guiding rails GR.I, GR.u, are mounted below the cutting area bottom CAB such that the guiding rails extend perpendicular to the conveying direction CD. The wheels roll along these guiding rails.

In one implementation at least one horizontal positioning means supports the lateral movement of the cutting assembly KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14 with respect to the cutting area bottom CAB. This horizontal positioning means can comprise a drive for rotating at least one wheel mounted at the cutting assembly, e.g. an electrical motor. The horizontal positioning means can also comprise at least one horizontal hydraulic cylinder, preferably a left hydraulic cylinder Cyl.l and a right hydraulic cylinder Cyl.r. The or every horizontal hydraulic cylinder is mounted with one side at the cutting area bottom CAB or at the frame and with the other side and the cutting assembly.

claim.claim-text: 1 . Conveying arrangement for conveying loose material in a conveying direction (CD),
the conveying arrangement is mounted at a frame or is adapted to be mounted at a frame,
the conveying arrangement comprises
- a cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 ... , Kn.14) with several knives (Kn.1 ... , Kn.14),
- a conveying assembly (R),
- a cutting area guiding surface (CAB),
- a further guiding surface (PPB),
- a connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG), and
- a positioning means (Cyl.l, Cyl.r),
the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14)
- is adapted for engaging from below through the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) and
- is mechanically connected with the cutting area guiding surface (CAB), the conveying assembly (R) is arranged
- for conveying loose material in the conveying direction (CD) and above and along the cutting area and above and along the further guiding surfaces (CAB,
PPB) and

- for cooperating with the knives (Kn.1 , ... , Kn.14) for cutting conveyed material, the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) with the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14) is pivotally connected or connectable with the frame
such that the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) can be pivoted with respect to the frame upwards and downwards,
the further guiding surface (PPB) is pivotally connected or connectable with the frame such that the further guiding surface (PPB) can be pivoted with respect to the frame upwards and downwards,
the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG)

- is arranged between the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) and the further guiding surface (PPB) and
- mechanically supports the two guiding surfaces (CAB, PPB) in a way that both guiding surfaces (CAB, PPB) can be pivoted with respect to the frame upwards and downwards,
the positioning means (Cyl.l, Cyl.r)
- is connected or can be connected with the frame and with the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG),
holds the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG) in a position with respect to the frame and
- is adapted for moving the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG) in an upward direction and in a downward direction,
the conveying arrangement is arranged such that
moving the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG) in the upward direction causes the cutting area and the further guiding surfaces (CAB, PPB) being pivoted upwards with respect to the frame and
- moving the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG) in the downward direction causes the cutting area and the further guiding surfaces (CAB, PPB) being pivoted downwards with respect to the frame,
the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 ... , Kn.14) is arranged
such that the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 ... , Kn.14) can be shifted laterally with respect to the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG)
in at least one lateral direction (LD) which is perpendicular or angular to the conveying direction (CD).
2. Conveying arrangement according to claim 1 ,
characterized in that
the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) can be pivoted with respect to the frame around a pivoting rotating axis (PA.1 ) which is perpendicular to the conveying direction (CD) and
the further conveying surface (PPB) can be pivoted with respect to the frame around a further pivoting axis (PA.5) which is also perpendicular to the conveying direction (CD).
3. Conveying arrangement according to claim 1 or claim 2,

characterized in that
at least one guiding surface (PPB) is pivotally connected with the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG)
such that this pivotally connected guiding surface (PPB) can be pivoted with respect to the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG)
around a pivoting axis (PA.4) which is perpendicular or angular to the conveying direction (CD).
4. Conveying arrangement according to one of the preceding claims, characterized in that
the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) is connected or connectable with the frame as well as with the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG)
such that the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) together with the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 ... , Kn.14) can be shifted in the lateral direction (LD)
- with respect to the frame and
- with respect to the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG).
5. Conveying arrangement according to claim 4,
characterized in that

the conveying arrangement further comprises a guiding means (GR.I, GR.u, TB) and the guiding means (GR.I, GR.u, TBG) is arranged for guiding the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) along the lateral direction (LD)
while the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) is shifted in the lateral direction (LD).
6. Conveying arrangement according to claim 5,
characterized in that
the guiding means (GR.I, GR.u, TB) comprises a rail system (GR.I, GR.u),
the rail system (GR.I, GR.u) extends in the lateral direction (LD),
the rail system (GR.I, GR.u) is mounted or can be mounted at the frame,
the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) is mechanically connected with at least one wheel (W.I, W.r),
the or every wheel (W.I, W.r)
- rolls in or on the rail system (GR.I, GR.u) and

- is rotatably connected with the cutting area guiding surface (CAB), and
the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) is mounted such that it can be pivoted with respect to the rail system (GR.I, GR.u).
7. Conveying arrangement according to claim 5 or claim 6,
characterized in that
the guiding means (GR.I, GR.u, TB) comprises a traversal beam (TB) mechanically connected or connectable with the frame,
the traversal beam (TB)
- extends in the lateral direction (LD) in which the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) can be shifted with respect to the frame and
- carries the cutting area guiding surface (CAB), and
the conveying arrangement is arranged such that the cutting area guiding surface (CAB)
- can be shifted along the traversal beam (TB) and
- can be pivoted around the traversal beam (TB).
8. Conveying arrangement according to one of the claims 4 to 7,
characterized in that
the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG) comprises a traversal bearing and gliding unit (TBG) with a gliding surface (GS),
the traversal bearing and gliding unit (TBG) supports the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) from below
such that the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) can glide laterally along the gliding surface (GS) in the lateral direction (LD).
9. Conveying arrangement according to claim 8,
characterized in that
the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG) comprises two longitudinal bearing units (LBU.I, LBU.r),
these two longitudinal bearing units (LBU.I, LBU.r)
- extend in the conveying direction (CD) and
- are rigidly connected by the traversal bearing and gliding unit (TBG).

10. Conveying arrangement according to one of the preceding claims,
characterized in that
the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 ... , Kn.14) is pivotally mounted at the cutting area guiding surface (CAB)
such that the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 Kn.14) can be pivoted into an operating position and into a non-operating position with respect to the cutting area guiding surface (CAB)
around a pivoting axis (PA.6) which is perpendicular to the conveying direction (CD), wherein
- in the operating position the knives (KnH, Kn.1 ... , Kn.14) penetrate the longitudinal slots (SI.1 , ... , SI.14) and
- in the non-operating position the knives (KnH, Kn.1 ... , Kn.14) are entirely below the cutting area guiding surface (CAB).
1 1 . Conveying arrangement according to one of the preceding claims, characterized in that
the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG) comprises two longitudinal bearing units (LBU.I, LBU.r) extending in the conveying direction (CD),
the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) is arranged between these two longitudinal bearing units (LBU.I, LBU.r)
such that - seen in the conveying direction (CD) - a left longitudinal bearing unit
(LBU.I) and a right longitudinal bearing unit (LBU.r) are formed, and
the positioning means (Cyl.l, Cyl.r) is mechanically connected with at least one longitudinal bearing unit (LBU.I, LBU.r).
12. Conveying arrangement according to claim 1 1 ,
characterized in that
the positioning means (Cyl.l, Cyl.r) comprises
- a left cylinder (Cyl.l) and
- a right cylinder (Cyl.r),
the left cylinder (Cyl.l) is connected with the left longitudinal bearing unit (LBU.I), and the right cylinder (Cyl.r) is connected with the right longitudinal bearing unit (LBU.r).

13. Conveying arrangement according to one of the preceding claims, characterized in that
the conveying arrangement comprises a retaining mechanism (Sp.l, Sp.r), the retaining mechanism (Sp.l, Sp.r)
- is connected or connectable with the frame and
- is connected with the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG),
the retaining mechanism (Sp. l, Sp.r) is adapted for moving the connecting assembly (LBU.I, LBU.r, TBG) against the force of gravity in the upward direction.
14. Conveying arrangement according to one of the preceding claims, characterized in that
the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) comprises several longitudinal slots (SI. , SI.14) extending in the conveying direction (CD),
the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14) comprises a knives holder (KnH) for holding the knives (Kn.1 , ... , Kn.14),

the knives holder (KnH) is mounted below the cutting area guiding surface (CAB), the knives (Kn.1 , Kn.14) penetrate the longitudinal slots (SI. , SI.14) in the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) when the knives (Kn.1 , Kn.14) are in an operating position, and
the conveying assembly (R) is arranged for pressing material through spaces between the knives (Kn.1 , Kn.14) penetrating the slots (SI. , SI.14).
15. Conveying arrangement according to one of the preceding claims, characterized in that
the conveying arrangement further comprises a cutting assembly shifting member (CyH .I, Cyllr),
the cutting assembly shifting means (Cyl1 .1, Cyl1 .r)
- is mechanically connected or connectable with the frame and
- is adapted for shifting the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 Kn.14) with respect to the frame in the lateral direction (LD).
16. Conveying arrangement according to claim 15,
characterized in that

the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) is mounted such that it can be shifted with respect to the further guiding surface (PPB) in the lateral direction (LD) while carrying the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 ... , Kn.14) and
the guiding surface shifting means (CyM .I, CyH .r) is adapted for shifting the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) together with the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 ... , Kn.14) in the lateral direction (LD).
17. Conveying arrangement for conveying loose material in a conveying direction (CD),
the conveying arrangement is mounted at or is adapted for being mounted at a frame,
the conveying arrangement comprises
- a cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14) with several knives (Kn.1 , Kn.14),
- a conveying assembly (R),
- a cutting area guiding surface (CAB), and
- a positioning means (Cyl.l, Cyl.r),
the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14) is mechanically connected with the cutting area guiding surface (CAB),
the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14) is adapted for engaging from below through the cutting area guiding surface (CAB),
the conveying assembly (R) is arranged
- for conveying loose material into the conveying direction (CD) and above and along the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) and
- for cooperating with the knives (Kn.1 , Kn.14) for cutting conveyed loose material,
the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) is connected or connectable with the frame such that the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) together with the cutting assembly
(KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14) can be shifted laterally with respect to the frame
in at least one lateral direction (LD) perpendicular or angular to the conveying direction (CD), and
the positioning means (Cyl.l, Cyl.r)
- is connected or connectable with the frame,
- is connected with the cutting area guiding surface (CAB), and

- is adapted for moving the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) together with the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14) upwards and downwards with respect to the frame and perpendicular or angular to the conveying direction (CD).
18. Conveying arrangement according to claim 17,
characterized in that
the conveying arrangement comprises a further guiding surface (PPB),

the further guiding surface (PPB) is also connected or connectable with the frame, the conveying arrangement is arranged for conveying the loose material along and above the further guiding surface (PPB), and
the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) is arranged such that the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) can be shifted in the lateral direction (LD) with respect to the further guiding surface (PPB).
19. Conveying arrangement according to claim 17 or claim 18,
characterized in that
the conveying arrangement comprises a cutting assembly shifting member (CyM . I, Cyllr),
the cutting assembly shifting member (Cyl1 .1, Cyl1 .r)
- is mechanically connected or connectable with the frame and
- is adapted for shifting the cutting area guiding surface (CAB) together with the cutting assembly (KnH, Kn.1 , Kn.14) with respect to the frame in the lateral direction (LD).
20. Feeding arrangement for feeding loose material,
the feeding arrangement comprises
- a frame and
- a conveying arrangement according to one of the preceding claims
wherein the conveying arrangement is connected with the frame.
21 . Vehicle for processing loose material lying on the ground,
the vehicle is adapted for being moved over the ground,
the vehicle comprises
- a pick-up unit for picking up loose material from the ground,
- a feeding arrangement according to claim 20, and
- a processing arrangement,

the feeding arrangement is adapted
- for feeding picked-up loose material to the processing arrangement and
- for cutting picked-up loose material, and
the processing arrangement is adapted for processing material being fed to the processing arrangement.
